userreviews.userReview: I wonder if something was lost in the translation of this book? I certainly hope so, because I found it did not live up to it's interesting description.After the sudden loss of her husband, Joe, shot during an armed bank robbery, Nora Cooper makes a startling discovery: shortly before his death, Joe secretly sold their newly purchased dream home on Martha’s Vineyard, where the couple had planned to retire.The plot had great possibilities which were never adequately explored, and there were several minor inconsistencies that irked me.If you like a romantic mystery, with the emphasis on the 'romantic' then you will probably enjoy this book. I prefer mine loaded more on the side of mystery.Words in the Dark was an okay read (I was never tempted not to finish), but I won't be looking out for more from this author.

WORDS IN THE DARK by Giulia BeymanThis is the first book I read in English, and I’m happy not only to have finished it, but to have done it in a few days. So, I’ll try to explain my experience in my Italian-English, be quiet.I think the credit for this belongs to the author skill. The story is told with a clear language, but the plot is at the same time excellent.In the suggestive frame of Martha’s Vineyard, Norah Cooper looses his beloved husband Joe, a respected policeman in Boston, killed during a robbery in a bank. But another bad news is coming when she knew that she had to leave their cottage in two weeks because Joe secretly sold it.Was he a liar? How could he? Last, but not least, Joe begins to send messages via scrabble, and Norah understands that there something very important other.When you start to read, you can’t stop and this is the first good thing. You discover characters and situations one by one, and you have to upset your attention to not loose any trail. In fact, nothing is left back and the final is worthy.This book is as good as any other mistery thriller, with the only difference that the author isn’t -yet- prominent.People who knows those places can easily recognize landscapes and ferries. We, bleeding hearts, can think about Harrison Ford and Michele Pfeiffer in “What lies beneath”. But this story can, more than this, let people who have never been there, recognize their imaginary, romantic dream about Nantucket, the cold wind, the leaf-full streets and the wooden houses, like real.

"Prima di dire addio" è la storia di una vedova che tenta di spiegarsi la perdita del marito e un'incomprensibile bugia di quest'ultimo, trovando le risposte - a rischio della propria vita - quando decide di indagare sui messaggi che le arrivano dall'aldilà. Il romanzo mi è piaciuto per due motivi. Il più ovvio è la sceneggiatura da thriller classico, robusta e priva di punti deboli, condita da sorprese, cattivi-che-sembrano-buoni e viceversa, con l'irruzione del paranormale e un finale appropriato. Il meno scontato è ciò che sta dietro la trama: la caratterizzazione dei personaggi e soprattutto una storia d'Amore con la A maiuscola, insolita perché ne sono protagonisti una donna e un uomo di mezza età, prossimo alla pensione. Non il tempo delle mele, una volta tanto, ma quello dei nipotini. E la malinconia della perdita raccontata con sensibilità, partecipazione e le parole dell'autunno della vita. È questa, secondo me, la marcia in più del racconto e la giustificazione del ritmo diseguale, che alterna le pause con le accelerazioni, i "perché" cercati con il piombo nel cuore a quelli scoperti con inquietudine, ansia e infine terrore. Un'opera matura dal mondo "indie" sullo sfondo non banale di Matha's Vineyard, isola turistica notissima negli USA ma meno in Italia, descritta in termini che mettono voglia di visitarla.

Words in the Dark is a tremendous mystery and suspense novel. I have previously read other stories written in Italian by Giulia Beyman and I am positively amazed by her English mystery novel.The main character, Nora, is a well developed and interesting woman who is coping with the loss of her husband - a cop killed during a robbery.It's impossible not to feel with Nora the huge pain she's been through, given also the many surprises her dead husband was holding for her.The paranormal aspect of the story spices up the plot enough to keep me glued to my Kindle and force me to go to bed very late at night!Definitely an author and a series to follow!I received a free, advance copy of this book from the publisher via NetGalley in exchange for my unbiased review.

Not reading this book is a "crime!"This book impressed me so much. Not only is a well-written crime book— it reminds me of Agatha Christie's classic, sophisticated and timeless style—, not only does it contain suspense and action, but it has a heart. The relationships that link the characters are deep and believable, and the problems the characters have to face are common in the everyday life of each one of us. Besides, wisely, the author adds a dash of romance to catch the attention of the female readers too. I fell for the protagonist, Nora, immediately. She suffers a terrible loss at the beginning of the story: her husband, a cop, has been killed during a bank robbery. Nora's life falls to pieces when she discovers that her husband has sold their house without telling her. But this is not the only mystery that crosses her life. Nora, a practical and solid person, finds herself involved in supernatural events. Has she become mad?One plot twist after the other, the reader follows Nora's stubborn search for the truth. Despite her pains and worries, she always does the right thing: she wants justice for her husband and she doesn't give up protecting her beloved ones; her daughter and her grandchildren. She is a fighter, she is smart, but she is also a woman with vulnerability: she missses her husband and she is afraid of losing her house. The reader can't help but follow her story with bated breath. I look forward to reading more. I'm sure the second book of Nora Cooper Mysteries won't disappoint me at all.

My Review: I loved this book. I always like a good who done it type book and this is one of the best I have read in a long time. Throw in a little paranormal and you have a winner. When Nora Cooper finds herself suddenly a widow after 30 years of marriage strange events begin unfolding that makes her doubt everything about her past life. Then messages from the other side contuse and frighten her more. With all of the confusion and doubt comes an ominous danger. This book definitely had me reading much later than I should have. I would highly recommend this book and it is one I would like to have on my to keep shelf. I will gladly look for more from this author. I believe the editing was fine, if it wasn't the story kept me so wrapped up I didn't notice. It gets a big old 5 star from me.
Questo racconto io lo definirei come un thriller-soft .Mi ha ricordato molto Mary Higgins Clark,ma meno brava nel delineare i personaggi.

Guilia Beyman is an Italian author and this book was translated from the Italian book entitled 'Prima di dire addio.' Although Guilia is Italian her books are set in the US which is an interesting mix. As someone passionate about all things Italian and who writes crime novels primarly set in the UK but with a strong Italian influence and many Italian characters I was keen to read Guilia's book. The English version is available as an ebook and readily available from Amazon. I found this to be an enjoyable and fast read and Guilia is very good at leaving enough dangling at the end of a chapter to make the reader continue reading. Guilia has a very easy writing style and I can tell that she has been a screenwriter as she writes great dialogue. I really took to her central character Nora who is a very well-rounded character.If you are looking for blood and guts and lots of dead bodies then this is not the book for you, as this is definitely a cozy crime novel. It doesn't have a particularly complicated plot but then neither did many of Agatha Christie's books and they are not short of appeal.I don't want to give away the plot as that spoils the read, but let's say Nora is possessed with certain 'gifts' that most of us don't have.All in all I'd recommend this book. Good to curl up with on a cold winter's evening. It only took me a few hours to read it and I am looking forward to reading the second book in the series 'A Cry in the Shadows.'

Nora is grieving for the loss of her husband, who has been killed during a bank robbery. The story starts this way, and as a reader you already feel hooked, you somehow feel her pain, and you start to care about this lovely character, as if she were a close friend. There are many surprises in store for Nora, and our heroine is thrown into a world of mystery, turmoil, where her emotions are shattered in such a way that sometimes she wonders about her mental sanity. I found myself glued to this book until 1 or 2 am, I just didn't want to put it down. It has you guessing, wondering and yet, it's never predictable, and things never turn out as you expect. I could see this novel turned into a film, as it's packed with action, drama, surprises, it would make a great movie. But it's also a fantastic book, something that really gets you involved and makes you forget about your ordinary life. That for me, is what a good book is all about.

Joe and Nora Cooper were going to enjoy their later years in their newly purchased dream home on Martha's Vineyard. But Joe has been killed, and not only that, he sold their dream home without even telling her. Nora doesn't believe her husband would do something like that, but maybe she didn't know her husband of thirty-five years as well as she thought she did. Searching for answers she gets a little help from Joe in the form of Scrabble letters - a game loved by their whole family. Nora uncovers one nasty truth after another until she has all the answers she was looking for.This book was good! It was so well-crafted. The story was believable - nothing was far-fetched or "convenient". It never dragged on. There were lots of twists and suspense. The characters were believable and well-developed. Unputdownable!

This book was different than what I expected, but that doesn't mean I didn't enjoy it. I read it on a car trip and found it to be a fantastic car read. The chapters were short so you made quick progress through the book. I enjoyed the story and was surprised at the ending. I wasn't expecting the paranormal aspect when I began this book, so I was hesitant when that was introduced but I found the topic to be handled nicely and only added to the overall story. It was an easy read and kept me guessing and wondering about how everything and everyone was connected throughout the entire story. I look forward to reading more books by Giulia Beyman! I received this book for free from Goodreads in return for my honest, unbiased opinion.

I got this book for free through Goodreds First-Reads giveaway by Amazon publishing. Overall I like this book. It has a slight supernatural element to a mystery story. The only thing I didn't like was the discovery of a diary that might explain a missing girl's past and motivation to leave her family. I mean how does the grandma have the diary and not tell anyone what it reveals. I like how three different incidents (missing girl, murder of a husband, and an almost secret selling of a cottage)and people involved in those situations are connected. The story is short (224 pages) but it's nice little mystery novel to read on a rainy day.

Giulia Beyman has given us a winning character in Nora Copper. I identified with Nora while reading of her emotional struggles, and cheered her as she tried to unravel the mysteries. The book is a well-done cozy, with a little supernatural thrown in, and very enjoyable. I look forward to reading more of Nora's adventures. I only wish more of Ms. Beyman's work were translated into EnglishI received a complimentary copy of this book in order to review it.

I didn't have a clue what to expect from this book. It started well and then in the last hundred pages I really got into and I must say that I really liked it. The story is well written and thought out. I didn't exactly know where the story was going, but it made it interesting and it made me suspicious of almost everybody. I also loved the supernatural kind of element to it which I really didn't expect, but was pleasantly surprised by.
I won this book in the Goodreads Giveaway! It was an excellent page turner that kept me guessing until the very end!
Loved the local setting in Boston and the Vineyard. Some mystery, some hauntings, and plenty of suspense. Will try another Beyman novel soon.
Un'autrice italiana che non fa rimpiangere le autrici anglosassoni. Brava Giulia!
Una bellissima rivelazione.
Volevo dargli tre perché si legge in fretta, ma alla fine con tutto quello che ho da ridire non sarebbe bastato a salvarlo.

Ho letto i tre libri di Giulia Beyman in rapida successione, avevo bisogno di una lettura leggera per riprendermi dal "Cardellino" di Donna Tartt. ;-))Li ho trovati molto carini, scorrevoli, con trame ben congegnate e personaggi per i quali si prova subito un certo attaccamento.Di solito non sopporto i capitoli da due pagine l'uno, ma in questo caso non mi hanno disturbato. I diversi punti di vista sulla storia anzi aggiungevano dei dettagli per la risoluzione del mistero che non vedevo l'ora finissero nelle mani della persona che avrebbe "tirato le fila" del libro. Ho trovato a volte delle piccole debolezze: nei libri (in particolare nel primo) c'è un'attenzione maniacale a cosa indossano le protagoniste femminili, tanto da informarci di ogni loro cambio d'abito; nel terzo volume invece abbiamo un capitolo intero dedicato alla preparazione della parmigiana di melanzane di Nora... Cosa che sinceramente mi interessa, ma non all'interno di un romanzo giallo :-P In genere non apprezzo molto neanche il paranormale inserito nella quotidianità, soprattutto quando è usato un po' come deus ex machina che risolve una situazione da cui altrimenti l'autore non saprebbe tirarsi fuori. Qui però è solo un mezzo che dà l'avvio all'indagine da parte di Nora, ed è sinceramente utilizzato bene. In conclusione per me si tratta di romanzi gialli ben congegnati e di piacevole lettura, forse un po' "leggerini", ma non tutti i libri possono essere premi Pulitzer... :-PP

da www.sognipensieriparole.comSi sente subito che dietro a questo libro c’è una sceneggiatrice, perché l’impianto è quasi cinematografico, con una serie di brevi capitoli che potrebbero corrispondere a tante inquadrature, piccoli tasselli che compongono gradualmente il puzzle finale e aumentano a mano a mano l’interesse e la tensione del lettore.Non sono una grande divoratrice di thriller, ma amo i libri dove più che una vicenda epocale sono le storie quotidiane, i dettagli trascurabili, le frasi sospese, le prime impressioni non colte a tenermi incollata alle pagine, nella ricerca della soluzione del mistero. Qui l’autrice è davvero abile nel creare più storie iniziali, nel disseminare gli indizi e poi nel far convergere le vicende in uno sbocco comune e inatteso, come un piccolo ragno che riconduce tutti i fili al centro. Certo, c’è un aspetto paranormale che manca nei gialli classici, ma direi che questa novità arricchisce il genere e rende unica e particolare Nora Cooper, l’agente immobiliare di mezza età che s’improvvisa detective. E poi io ho sempre trovato particolarmente toccante l’idea che nell’aldilà chi ci ha voluto bene non si dimentichi di noi e cerchi di continuare a vegliare (o comunque di avvertirci). In fondo, chi non vorrebbe avere lo Scarabeo di Nora, anche solo per una sera, e vedere comparire un “ciao” da qualcuno amato, perduto e mai dimenticato?Consigliato (se da mesi guida la classifica, ci sono ottimi motivi).

Nora is shocked when she discovers some murky goings on after her husband Joe is killed. Her home is being sold from under her and there's some missing money. How well did she really know the man she married? Then comes the paranormal which puts a different slant on the story. The book was easy to read with a twist or two. It was engrossing and I enjoyed it but it isn't the sort of book which keeps you thinking about it after the last page has been turned. Many thanks to the publisher and Netgalley for the ARC.

Words in the Dark was a pretty good book, I wouldn't say I loved it but I did enjoy it! I liked the whole paranormal aspect of the story but the ending fell a little flat for me. I would definitely read more by this author & would recommend this for fans of lighter mysteries. Thank you to Amazon Publishing and NetGalley for providing me with a complimentary copy of this book in exchange for my honest review.

Non conoscevo le opere di questa autrice, ma ho letteralmente divorato Prima di dire addio. Tanto che, appena terminato, ho subito comprato il successivo, Luce dei miei occhi!Scrittura scorrevole, personaggi ben delineati e buona suspence. Il dono di Nora, ossia sentire le voci dall'aldilà, all'inizio mi aveva lasciato perplessa. Ma il tutto è stato trattato con abilità tanto da convincere anche i più scettici! Brava!

La prima parola che mi viene in mente pensando a questo romanzo è “garbato”. Si tratta di un giallo che sconfina nel paranormale, una lettura fluida anche se non proprio avvincente. La scrittura è semplice ma, appunto, garbata, e, nonostante che la storia si apra con una sparatoria, ho trovato la storia “tranquilla”, forse per come sono dipinti i personaggi. Un romanzo gradevole.

I love getting lost in a book. I love it even more when I can't read fast enough to get to the climax of the plot. Giulia Beyman's story of Nora, her dead husband's scrabble tiles, and a missing girl is riveting. I look forward to reading the second book in the series, but not before I finish the laundry and get a bite to eat!

Una scrittura scorrevole che tiene incollati alla lettura fino all'ultima pagina. Un cerchio che man mano si stringe rivelando trame misteriose. E dopo questo bellissimo romanzo sono già pronta con il secondo!

Un thriller dai toni soft che per questo avvince ancora di più. Nessuna superdonna come protagonista, ma una nonna con un carico umano enorme. Un romanzo piacevolissimo che sa sorprendere coinvolgere. E scritto in maniera impeccabile.Complimenti all'autrice.
Enjoyable.Good reading for a rainy day like today. Good story and likeable characters. And, life does go on in many forms, believe it or not.
3 stelline e mezzo

description: After the sudden loss of her husband, Joe, Nora Cooper makes a startling discovery: shortly before his death, Joe secretly sold their newly purchased dream home on Martha’s Vineyard, where the couple had planned to retire.Nora doesn’t know what to think. As she searches for answers, she is tormented by grief and doubt—until she starts receiving mysterious and inexplicable messages in Scrabble letters, messages that Nora believes could have been written only by Joe.Using a strength she didn’t know she had, Nora follows these strange clues to discover the truth about Joe and their life together—and navigates the danger inherent in her new, special gift.
title:
Words in the Dark
      
          (Nora Cooper Mysteries #1)
